conclusion: The task is to predict which container (E or F) each liquid will flow into after passing through baffles.
Liquid A (Yellow) starts from the top left.
Liquid A flows directly down through the green and red baffle.
Liquid A hits the white baffle horizontally, then continues down.
Liquid A follows the grey baffle towards the right.
Liquid A's path leads directly into Container E.
Liquid B (Cyan) starts from the top center-left.
Liquid B flows down through the green and red baffle.
Liquid B hits the white baffle horizontally, then continues down.
Liquid B follows the grey baffle towards the right.
Liquid B's path leads directly into Container E.
Liquid C (Pink) starts from the top center-right.
Liquid C flows down through the grey and pink baffle.
Liquid C hits the white baffle horizontally, then continues down.
Liquid C follows the black baffle towards the left.
Liquid C's path leads directly into Container F.
Liquid D (Blue) starts from the top right.
Liquid D flows directly down through the pink and grey baffle.
Liquid D hits the white baffle horizontally, then continues down.
Liquid D follows the black baffle towards the left.
Liquid D's path leads directly into Container F.
Liquid A flows into Container E.
Liquid B flows into Container E.
Liquid C flows into Container F.
Liquid D flows into Container F.
Final Answer: A and B flow into Container E; C and D flow into Container F.
